qas.question: Who was the father of Abd al-Malik?
When did Abd al-Malik's rule begin?
Who was the father of Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyyah?
In what year did Ibn al-Zubayr die?
What span of years did Marwan rule?
Who was another son of Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyyah?
When did the Umayyads defeat the troops of al-Mukhtar near Mosul?

context: <a0_0><b5_0>Marwan<b5_0/><a0_0/> was succeeded by his son, Abd al-Malik (<a1_0><b6_0>685<a1_0/>–705<b6_0/>), who reconsolidated Umayyad control of the caliphate. The early reign of Abd al-Malik was marked by the revolt of Al-Mukhtar, which was based in <a2_0>Kufa<a2_0/>. Al-Mukhtar hoped to elevate Muhammad ibn al-Hanafiyyah, another son of <a3_0>Ali<a3_0/>, to the caliphate, although Ibn al-Hanafiyyah himself may have had no connection to the revolt. <b7_0>The troops of al-Mukhtar<b7_0/> engaged in battles both with the Umayyads in 686, defeating them at the river Khazir near Mosul, and with Ibn al-Zubayr in <b8_0>687<b8_0/>, at which time the revolt of al-Mukhtar was crushed. In 691, Umayyad troops reconquered Iraq, and in <a4_0>692<a4_0/> the same army captured Mecca. Ibn al-Zubayr was killed in the attack.
